text:
Choose the option that has the same vowel sound as the one represented by the letters underlined.
boat
explanation:
boat- /bəʊt/
board - /bɔːd/
bought - /bɔːt/
go -/ɡəʊ/
glory - /ˈɡlɔː.ri/
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that has the same vowel sound as the one represented by the letters underlined.
Air
explanation:
airandheirare both nouns with the same vowel sounds pronounced as /eə/
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that has the same vowel sound as the one represented by the letters underlined.
Pleasure
explanation:
pleasure is pronounced as [ˈpleʒə], our area of emphasis is on the ''ea'' sound which goes thus ''e''.
pliable--- [ˈplʌɪəb(ə)l]
pleat----- [pliːt]
plenary-- [ˈpliːnəri]
jeopardy--- [ˈdʒepədi]. from the list of possible pronunciations above, you can see that only jeopardy [ˈdʒepədi] has the vowel sound ''e'' and it is therefore the correct answer to the question.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that has the same vowel sound as the one represented by the letters underlined.
Thunder
explanation:
Thunder |ˈθʌndə|(a) prefer |prɪˈfɜː|(b) differ  |ˈdɪfə|(c) confer  |kənˈfɜː|(d) defer |dɪˈfɜː|
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that has the same vowel sound as the one represented by the letters underlined.
Tear (noun)
explanation:
The noun tear is pronounced as /tɪə/
dare - /deə/
care - /keə/
hear - /hɪə/
wear - /weə/
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options the word that has the same consonant sound as the one represented by the underlined.
Thought
explanation:
Both thought and theater have similar consonant sounds at the beginning. The 'th' is pronounced alike with the tip of the tongue in between the front teeth. Hence we have;
thought: /θɔːt/
theatre: /ˈθɪətə/
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options the word that has the same consonant sound as the one represented by the underlined.
Caliph
explanation:
caliph; /ˈkeɪlɪf,ˈkalɪf/
powerful; /ˈpaʊəfʊl,ˈpaʊəf(ə)l/
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the word that has the same pattern of stress as the given word.
Enormous
explanation:
The stress pattern of a word is the way all the syllables are stressed in it. There can be main and secondary stress, or unstressed sounds.
The word SO-LU-TION has the same stress pattern as E-nor-mous as they are both stressed on the second syllable.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the word that has the same pattern of stress as the given word.
Honour
explanation:
Honour is stressed asHO-nour.  /ˈɒnə/
same asHU-man /ˈhjuːmən/
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the word that has the same pattern of stress as the given word.
Quality
explanation:
Quality is stressed on the first syllable /ˈkwɒlɪti/
A. guarantee  is stressed on the third syllable /ɡar(ə)nˈtiː/
B. accepted  is stressed on the second syllable /əkˈsɛptid/
C. bachelor  is stressed on the first syllable /ˈbatʃələ/
D. related  is stressed on the second syllable /rɪˈleɪt/
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the word that has the same pattern of stress as the given word.
Education
explanation:
Education -  e-du-CA-tion
A.  Duplicity -  du-PLI-ci-ty
B. Economics  - e-co-NO-mics
C. Elaborate  - E-LA-bo-rate
D. Conjectural - con-JEC-tu-ral
Both education and economics have stress in the third syllable.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Identify the word that has the stress on the second syllable.
explanation:
A. reproduce /riːprəˈdjuːs/ - stress is on the third syllable
B. always /ˈɔːlweɪz/ - stress is on the first syllable
C. result /rɪˈzʌlt/- stress is on the second syllable
D. understand /ʌndəˈstand/ - stress is on the third syllable
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Identify the word that has a different stress pattern from the others.
explanation:
IN-te-gral -  /ˈɪn.tɪ.ɡrəl/
IN-ti-mate - /ˈɪn.tɪ.mət/
DIS-course -  /ˈdɪs.kɔːs/
ac-CE-le-rate -/əkˈsel.ə.reɪt/
Words that end with "ate' are stressed on the third syllable from the last.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill the gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.
Without our relentless campaigns we might ....... sure of victory in the race for the National Assembly.
explanation:
The complete sentence would be: "Without our relentless campaigns, we might never have been sure of victory in the race for the National Assembly." This option uses the correct auxiliary verbs ("never have been") to convey the meaning that victory in the race for the National Assembly would not have been certain without the relentless campaigns.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill the gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.
To check desertification in the arid zones ...... trees should be planted.
explanation:
In the context of combating desertification in arid zones, the term "drought-resistant" refers to the ability of trees to withstand or survive in dry conditions with minimal water availability. Planting drought-resistant trees is a strategic approach to address the challenges posed by desertification, as these trees can thrive and contribute to ecosystem stability even in regions prone to drought.
Options A, B, and C also relate to the concept of dealing with drought, but "drought-resistant" specifically emphasizes the ability of the trees to resist or endure the effects of drought. Therefore, it is the most suitable option in the given sentence.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill the gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.
I like the character that played the role of a political ....... at the last convention of our party.
explanation:
"turncoat" refers to a person who changes their allegiance or political party. In this context, if someone played the role of a political turncoat, it means they portrayed a character who switched sides or changed political affiliations.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill the gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.
The man declared his intention from the -----
explanation:
A. Outset - This refers to the beginning or start of something. In the context of the sentence, "from the outset" implies that the man declared his intention right from the beginning.
B. Inset - An inset typically refers to a smaller section of a larger whole, often used in maps or diagrams. It doesn't fit the context of declaring intention.
C. Onset - This usually refers to the beginning or start of something, similar to "outset." However, "from the onset" isn't as commonly used as "from the outset" in this context.
D. Offset - This means to counterbalance or compensate for something. It doesn't fit the context of declaring intention.
Given the context of declaring intention, "from the outset" is the most appropriate option as it directly implies that the declaration was made from the very beginning or start.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill the gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.
The Team Manager told us that the race could only be won by the .......
explanation:
To be swift-footed means  having rapidly moving feet or able to run very quickly
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill the gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.
The new school is not provided with .......for science practicals.
explanation:
The correct phrase is "enough equipment." In English, "equipment" is a collective noun, and when referring to more than one item, you use the same form "equipment" without adding an "s" at the end. Therefore, the correct sentence is:
"The new school is not provided with enough equipment for science practicals."
Using "equipments" or any other variations would be grammatically incorrect.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill the gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.
llesa witnessed the largest ..... of writers at any convention in recent times.
explanation:
A. turnaround - This term typically refers to a change in direction or a reversal of a situation. It doesn't fit well in the context of a gathering or convention.
B. turnover - This term is often used in business contexts to refer to the rate at which employees leave a company and are replaced. It doesn't convey the idea of a gathering or attendance.
C. turn-out - This term is commonly used to describe the number of people who attend an event or gathering. In the context of a convention, "turn-out" is the most suitable term to convey the idea of the largest number of writers attending.
D. turn-on - This term usually refers to something that excites or interests someone. It doesn't convey the idea of a gathering or convention.
Therefore, "turn-out" is the most appropriate option as it accurately represents the number of writers present at the convention in Ilesa.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill the gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.
The politicians were ....... by the press.
explanation:
It means that the politicians faced criticism or mockery from the press. "Ridiculed" means to mock or make fun of someone.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill the gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.
There are several ........ in the farmyard.
explanation:
The use of the premodifier "several" suggests that a plural noun should fill in the gap. "Sheep" is the only plural noun in the option.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill the gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.
Audu fought with his ........ brother.
explanation:
When referring to siblings, "elder" is used to indicate the brother or sister who is older in age. While "older" is also a correct term to use in this context, "elder" is more specific when talking about family relationships. "Elder" shows the seniority in age within the family, making it the most appropriate option in this case.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill the gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.
The Dark Continent was an ...... for Africa.
explanation:
An "epithet" is a descriptive term or phrase that characterises and identifies a person or thing. In the context of the sentence, "The Dark Continent" is an epithet for Africa. This term has been historically used to describe Africa due to the perceived mystery and unfamiliarity that early European explorers and writers associated with the continent. Therefore, option D, "epithet," is the most fitting choice to complete the sentence.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill the gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.
He arrived ....... to see his family leave for the countryside.
explanation:
The phrase "in time" means arriving before an event occurs. He arrived in time to see his family before they left. "late" would mean he missed them entirely. So, the complete sentence should read: "He arrived in time to see his family leave for the countryside."
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill the gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.
You can travel on your own, ......?
explanation:
"Can't you" is appropriate because it matches the positive form of the statement ("Youcantravel on your own"). Question tags repeat the sentence's meaning in the opposite form to create a confirmation.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill the gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.
Our culture does not allow one to ........ when an elderly person is speaking.
explanation:
To "cut in" means to interrupt someone while they are speaking. Our culture does not allow children to interrupt when an elderly person is speaking. "Cut of" and "cut on" are not phrasal verbs and do not make sense in any context. "Cut off" means to stop the supply of something. E.g. "He cut off the electricity supply until they paid their rent"
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill the gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.
Raffle draws, like gambling, often end in a ....... for me.
explanation:
For the sentence, a noun is the most suitable option to fill in the gap because of the article "a" that comes before the gap. Therefore, option B. loss is the answer to the question.
"Lost" and "loose" are adjectives. "Lost" means unable to find one's way; "loose" means not firmly or tightly put in place.
"Lose" is a verb which means to cease to have something.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
If he were here, it could be more fun.

options.A: He did not show up and so the occasion lacked much fun
options.B: He was being expected to supply more fun
options.C: There was not fun because he was not present
options.D: He was expected but did not show up to liven up the occasion

explanation:
If he were here, it could be more fun
This statement was referring to a third singular person. This means that, the event was fun. But the fun could have been more if that person was present.
''It could'' as used in the statement is a probability. There is no assurance that the presence of that particular person would bring more fun.
Option A is the correct option.
He did not show up and so the occasion lacked much fun
Meaning there was fun, but it wasn't much fun because he wasn't present.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
Though he is our elected representative he often takes a rather jaundiced view of our problems.

options.A: He takes  a rather hazy view of our problems
options.B: He takes an unfavourable position concerning our problems
options.C: He takes  a rather forceful view of our problems
options.D: He takes a sickly view of our problems

explanation:
The phrase "a rather jaundiced view" means a biased or cynical perspective often stemming from an unfavourable stance. Therefore, optionBis the closest in meaning because it shows that the representative holds a negative opinion about the problems faced by the constituents.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
When I visited James I only gave him a congratulatory card on account of his promotion.

options.A: The only person I visited was James and nobody else
options.B: It was only James that I gave a congratulatory card to
options.C: All I gave James when I visited him was a congratulatory card
options.D: All I did when I visited James was given him a congratulatory card

explanation:
The sole action taken during the visit was to give James a congratulatory card.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
The events of last Friday show that there is no love lost between the principal and the Vice-Principal.
explanation:
No love lost between two people means that they are not friends, they dislike each other intensely. If there is "no love lost" between two people, they have a strong hatred, hostility or enmity for the other person and make no attempt to conceal it.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
The politician's inflammatory remarks were heavily criticised.

options.A: The politican's rude remarks were heavily criticised
options.B: The politician's provocative remarks were heavily criticised
options.C: The politician's bombastic remarks were heavily criticised
options.D: The politician's tribalistic remarks were heavily criticised

explanation:
The word"inflammatory"refers to something likely to provoke strong feelings of anger or hostility. Therefore,"provocative"captures this essence well.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
The Governor told the chief that he was only on a routine tour.
explanation:
The term"routine"means something done regularly or as part of a normal procedure. Therefore,A. normal and regular visitis the option that most closely aligns with this meaning.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
The boy was told that he would need several more pints of blood if he was to survive.
explanation:
The word "several" in the context of the sentence indicates an unspecified but relatively large number. It suggests that the boy would need more than just a few pints of blood in order to survive. Option A, "many," is the closest in meaning to "several" as it also implies a large but unspecified quantity.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
The principal told the teacher to stop browbeating the children.
explanation:
The term "browbeating" means to intimidate or bully someone, often through harsh or aggressive words. So, B. bullying is the best choice.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
Some actions of the Nigerian youth have alienated them from those who were sympathetic to their cause.
explanation:
A. endeared / kindly: "Endeared" means to make someone fond of or attached to something. It is the opposite of "alienated," which means to be isolated or estranged. So, option A is the opposite in meaning.
B. confronted / ill disposed: "Confronted" means to face or address an issue directly. It does not convey the idea of being isolated or separated, so option B is not the correct choice.
C. separated / opposed: "Separated" is similar in meaning to "alienated," but the second part, "opposed," does not match the idea of being sympathetic. Option C is partially correct in terms of separation but is not a perfect match.
D. estranged / well disposed: "Estranged" is very close in meaning to "alienated," as it implies being emotionally or socially distanced. "Well disposed" means to be favorably inclined or friendly. Option D is the most suitable choice as it captures the idea of separation (estranged) and the initial sympathy (well disposed).
So, the correct answer is D. estranged / well disposed.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
The essay topic is nebulous.
explanation:
The word"nebulous"means unclear or "vague."
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
The man was able to persuade his willful and obstinate daughter to follow the career he chose for her.
explanation:
In this context, the words"willful"and"obstinate"describe a daughter who is stubborn and resistant to change. Therefore "unyielding and obdurate" is nearest in meaning to this. "Unyielding" means not giving way to pressure and "obdurate" means stubbornly unwilling to change one's opinion or course of action.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
Mr. Okon has been described as an eagle-eyed editor.
explanation:
The term "eagle-eyed" is used metaphorically to describe someone exceptionally observant, vigilant and detail-oriented. Being an eagle-eyed editor means having a keen ability to spot errors or inconsistencies in written material. The nearest in meaning to "eagle-eyed" is "quick-sighted". It means marked by keen quickly responsive sight. "Clear-sighted" means having a good understanding of a particular subject and the ability to make good judgments about it.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
In spite of her grim situation, the young widow smiled dutifully at the visitor's pleasantries.
explanation:
In this context, the word"pleasantries"refers to polite or agreeable remarks that are often exchanged during social interactions. Given that the widow is in a "grim situation," the remarks are likely related to her loss and would be considered "condolence messages."
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
I have always believed that my mother is a very impassioned woman.
explanation:
The term"impassioned"means filled with or showing great emotion, enthusiasm or passion. Therefore, "emotional" would be nearest in meaning to "impassioned."
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
The party gathering was thrown into a state of euphoria after the election result was announced.
explanation:
The term"euphoria"refers to a state of intense happiness and excitement. WhileA. pleasurecaptures a similar sentiment,excitementbetter conveys the heightened emotional state associated with a significant event like an election result.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
The family discussed the crime committed and resolved to nail the lie to the counter.
explanation:
The expression "nail the lie to the counter" means confronting, exposing or making the lie known. Therefore, option A. expose it publicly is nearest in meaning to the expression.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
My father was at the apogee of his career when he was retired.
explanation:
The term "apogee" refers to the highest point in the development or progress of something.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
Though David's condition is serious, his life is not in immediate danger.
explanation:
The word "grave" is synonymous with "serious." Both terms imply a state of being critical or urgent.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
That punch by the young boxer proved to be fatal.
explanation:
The word "fatal" means something that causes death or is capable of causing death. Therefore, the nearest in meaning to the word is "deadly."
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
The presence of the security men in the area will provide a moment of respite for the residents.
explanation:
The phrase "a moment of respite" means a break or a pause from something difficult or unpleasant. This means that the relief provided is temporary.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
It is time for all concerned to first pick to pieces the strike action before proffering solutions.
explanation:
The phrase "pick to pieces" means to examine something very closely or to "critically analyse" something with the intent of finding faults or understanding its components.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
The new ruler is big-hearted in his dealing with people
explanation:
The term "big-hearted" is used to describe someone who is generous, kind and compassionate. In the given sentence,  the new ruler is characterised by a generous and kind approach in his dealings with people. Option A, "generous," is the nearest in meaning to  "big-hearted" and is the most appropriate choice in this context.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options opposite in meaning to the word underlined.
The teacher announced that the class would be making a fleeting visit to the zoo.
explanation:
The word "fleeting" means lasting for a very short time, brief, or transient. The opposite of "fleeting" is something that is long-lasting or enduring. Therefore, option C, "long," is the opposite in meaning. It indicates a visit that is not brief but rather of an extended or prolonged duration. Options A and D are not opposite in meaning, and option B is a synonym for "fleeting."
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options opposite in meaning to the word underlined.
The project is designed to alleviate poverty in the country.
explanation:
The word "alleviate" means to make something less severe or to reduce it—in this case, poverty. Therefore, the opposite would be to make poverty worse or to "exacerbate" it.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options opposite in meaning to the word underlined.
Civil engineering is predominantly a male profession.
explanation:
In this context, "predominantly" means that something is mainly or primarily characteristic of a certain group—in this case, civil engineering is mainly a male profession. Therefore, the opposite would imply that it is not mainly male or is infrequently associated with males.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options opposite in meaning to the word underlined.
The officer said that he knew nothing to the detriment of the applicant.
explanation:
In this context, "detriment" means harm or damage that could negatively affect the applicant. Therefore, the opposite of detriment would be something beneficial or advantageous to the applicant.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options opposite in meaning to the word underlined.
When the driver applied the brakes, they acted up.
explanation:
The phrase "acted up" implies that the brakes malfunctioned or did not perform well. Therefore, the opposite would be that it "responded well."
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options opposite in meaning to the word underlined.
The striking workers have vowed not to return to work until the decision is rescinded
explanation:
The word "rescinded" means to revoke, cancel or take back a decision. Therefore, the opposite of rescinding would be to put a decision into effect or carry it out.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options opposite in meaning to the word underlined.
It is rare for a leader and his deputy to see eye to eye.
explanation:
The phrase "see eye to eye" means to agree or have a shared perspective on a matter. Therefore, the opposite of this would be to disagree.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options opposite in meaning to the word underlined.
Common sense requires that one should be decorous at formal gatherings.
explanation:
The word "decorous" means exhibiting proper behaviour, good manners and etiquette, especially in formal settings. Therefore, the opposite of being decorous would be behaving in a manner that is inappropriate or "impolite".
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options opposite in meaning to the word underlined.
The diminutive figure bounces over the track with unfathomable lightness.
explanation:
The word "unfathomable" means something difficult or impossible to understand or measure. It is something that is beyond comprehension. The word "predictable" is the opposite of "unfathomable" because it means something that can be anticipated or is expected and that is straightforward.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options opposite in meaning to the word underlined.
I'm not interested in buying that shirt. I think it is overpriced.
explanation:
The word "overpriced" means that the price of the shirt is too high relative to its value or quality. The opposite of being overpriced inexpensive or cheap.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options opposite in meaning to the word underlined.
Despite his laxity in other matters, Ojo's father drew the line at truancy.
explanation:
The phrase "drew the line at" means to set a limit or establish a boundary regarding what is acceptable or permissible. Therefore, the opposite of "drew the line" is to have a lack of such boundaries. A. Favoured means supporting or being lenient towards something is the opposite of setting strict limits. B. rejected means refusing something. C. emphasized means to stress or highlight something. D. ignored means neglecting an issue.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose from the options opposite in meaning to the word underlined.
The string was taut.
explanation:
The word "taut" means pulled tight or not slack. Therefore, the opposite of taut is "loose," which indicates that something is not tight and has some give or slack.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the word underlined.
Hypertension is a debilitating disease that everyone should prevent.
explanation:
The word "debilitating" suggests weakening or impairing, so the opposite in meaning would be an energizing
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the word or phrase underlined.
The Permanent Secretary left his job under a cloud.
explanation:
The phrase "under a cloud" means to be in a state of suspicion, disfavour or disgrace as a result of negative circumstances or controversy. Therefore, the opposite of this phrase would be "with a clear record," which means that the person left without any negative implications or suspicion.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word or phrase.
We intend to make the reception a diurnal event.
explanation:
The word "diurnal" means occurring during the daytime or happening every day. Therefore, the opposite meaning would refer to something that happens at night.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word or phrase.
It is surprising that this politician has now turned renegade.
explanation:
A "renegade" is someone who betrays or rebels against an organization, cause or principle. Such a person is disloyal to such organisation, cause or principle. Therefore, the opposite of "renegade" would be someone loyal, as they would remain faithful to their commitments or beliefs.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
